August 17, 1960
Dr. Harry J. Skornia
Executive Director, NAEB
University of Illinois
Urbana, Illinois
Dear Harry:

AUG 1 8 I960

By mistake my copy of your August 9 letter to the Board , and
the accompanying ballot ..was included by mistake in Jim Miles' mail.
I am, therefore, tardy in returning the ballot* Nevertheless, here
it is in time, I hope, to be counted.
The report of the "Search" Committee was indeed welcome for I
have been like a hen on a hot griddle as I wondered what was
happening. The Committee's solution seems to be a most wise and
appropriate one, and we are fortunate in having Bill's agreement
to do the honors for the coming year. I can't quite picture us
without you in charge of the reins and I hope, without leaning
too hard,- that we can avail ourselves of the wisdom and the
many competencies which are responsible for guiding us through
stormy waters during the past decade.
Frankly, I am pleased about the revised schedule for the
Board meeting in San Francisco for that will give me the
privilege of three extra days to bask in your sunshine;
Best wishes always, / ,
x ySincerely yours.
jMrs.) Gertrude G. Broderick
Ladio-TV Education Specialist
